channel.title: Really cool way to learn JavaScript (And Fun!) :D
channel.description:
Hi guys,
A while back a friend of mine popped me an e-mail with a link to this website called Codecademy that teaches JavaScript. I have used the site and found it really useful (and fun!). I thought of this community on here and decided, "what better place to share this with?". So here it is: [url=http://www.codecademy.com/#!/exercises/0]http://www.codecademy.com/#!/exercises/0[/url]. I hope you find this useful if not fun at least :P
Note: This is just for those that actually might be interested in learning JavaScript (like me). Also, this is totally free, which is a plus! ;) :)
-Ghostly150

item.title: Really cool way to learn JavaScript (And Fun!) :D
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

[quote=“ollie123, post:10, topic:440066”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=542748.msg3977820#msg3977820 date=1334875460]
I have a subscription to http://www.codeschool.com/. Mostly for learning web languages and utilities like RoR, Coffeescript, jQuery. This looks neat too though.
[/quote]

How is codeschool? I was thinking about singing up but I want to get a second opinion first.[/quote]
I did codeschool. it think its nice. there are a couple free classes so it doesnt hurt to sign up and take those classes and test it out. i havent done codeacademy so idk how they compare but they kinda look similar.

Read full topic
